meanings.definition: An insistent and peremptory request, made as if by right.
meanings.sent1: The customer made a demand for a refund after receiving a faulty product.
meanings.sent2: There was a high demand for tickets to the concert.
meanings.sent3: The cat made a demand for more treats by meowing loudly.
meanings.sent4: The demand for justice echoed through the courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The demand for change grew stronger with each passing day.

meanings.definition: The desire to purchase goods and services.
meanings.sent1: The demand for new smartphones is increasing among teenagers.
meanings.sent3: The demand for ice cream on a hot day is always high.
meanings.sent4: Her demand for designer handbags knows no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The demand for rare collectibles never seems to diminish.

meanings.sent1: The teacher will demand respect from the students.
meanings.sent2: The boss demanded that the report be completed by the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: I demand to speak to the manager immediately!
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds demanded attention as they rolled in ominously.
meanings.sent5: The roaring lion demanded silence from the jungle.
